modules.description: Handles syslog message encoding and transport over UDP, TCP, and TLS using effectful layers like Unix, Lwt, and MirageOS. Processes log events from the Logs library and serializes them into RFC 3164-compliant messages. Enables real-time log forwarding in networked applications, embedded systems, and cloud environments with secure logging capabilities.

Provides functions to construct and frame syslog messages with specified facilities, hosts, sources, and timestamps. Works with syslog message structures, log levels, and custom framing options for TCP, TLS, and UDP transports. Used to generate structured log entries for remote syslog servers with configurable transport and message formatting.

Provides functions to send log messages via UDP, TCP, or Unix domain sockets to a syslog server. Operates on syslog message structures, inet addresses, and Unix socket paths, with options to control message truncation, framing, and facility codes. Used to forward application logs to remote or local syslog services for centralized monitoring and storage.
